Are you passionate about building?

And excited to work with cutting-edge technology?

Do you play well with others?

Here's your chance to join one of Toronto's fastest-growing technology companies!

We're cultivating a supportive and inclusive technology team that is building an excellent product.

We proudly build upon and use open-source technologies. We also support your choice of OS for your personal development environment, including Linux.

Statflo is committed to its team and invests in great people to build a great product and a great company. As a member of our engineering team, you will have a hand in shaping our tools, building our exciting product, and working with cutting-edge technology.

What Our Software Does:
Statflo provides a one-to-one outreach platform for front-line staff in retail and other sectors to build authentic relationships with their customers. Statflo's platform is deployed in thousands of stores and corporate headquarters in North America.

Why It Matters:
Millions of retail workers are handed a broom, or they're left unsupervised, during the eight hours they are idle each week. We challenge this status quo by empowering them to increase sales themselves and ultimately make more money. Countless retail customers want a better customer experience, with personal, proactive, and timely service. With Statflo, service of this caliber is right in the palm of their hands.

The Role:
You will be responsible for assisting and supporting the QA team with their daily testing activities. Not only will you be assisting, but also contributing your ideas and learning as much as you can through the term.

We are hiring for the Fall term: September - December 2021

Please review full eligibility requirements here before applying: https://careerready.technationcanada.ca/

What You'll Do:

  • Participate in new feature development and improvements with the product team
  • Create new test cases
  • Continuously improve test processes by contributing ideas and having discussions with the team
  • Drive exploratory testing
  • Execute regression, sanity and risk-based testing
  • Assist with developing Test Strategies
  • Understand and generate testing scenarios from acceptance criteria
  • Possibly participate in after-hours deployments
  • Working with the Customer Success team to do bug investigations

You'll be Successful in this Role If:

  • Currently working towards a degree in Computer Science, or related
  • Ability to spot problems easily and reproduce them
  • Ability to work autonomously in a fast-paced environment.
  • Deep knowledge of all the standard browsers on IOS/Android/Windows and MacOS
  • Have a user mindset and strongly advocate for the best user experiences
  • Good interpersonal and verbal and written communication skills
  • Boundless positivity and drive to improve
  • Strong sense of both ownership and humour
  • Effective communication and strong collaboration skills
  • Strong troubleshooting and problem-solving skills
  • Must be enrolled in a post-secondary institution or co-op-based program (due to funding requirements for this position)
  • Must be a Canadian Citizen, Permanent Resident or Refugee (due to funding requirements for this position)

Statflo welcomes and encourages applications from all backgrounds and people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment selection process.

Equal Opportunity Employment:
Statflo is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity, inclusion, and belonging. We are happy to consider all qualified applicants for employment regardless of race, colour, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, neurodiversity, protected veteran status, Aboriginal and Native status or any other legally-protected factors. Statflo has a zero-tolerance policy for discrimination and prides itself on assessing talent needs based on an objective methodology.

If accessibility accommodations are required during the recruitment process, we will gladly make the necessary arrangements to ensure Statflo is able to support all interested applicants.

Cuberg is commercializing a next-generation lithium metal battery to power the rise of electric mobility. Our battery technology provides huge benefits in terms of energy density, power, and safety, all in a format that allows for rapid scaling. Be part of a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to transform the future of electric mobility.

We are currently seeking motivated Interns in the areas of materials science, engineering, data, and test. These positions require strong knowledge in chemistry, engineering, data, or science.

We are looking for candidates who have a passion for making an impact in our sustainable energy future and who will thrive in a rapidly evolving, close-knit, and dynamic early-stage startup environment. The ideal candidate will think independently, be unafraid to take on major responsibilities, and perform all tasks with diligence and care.

Join us in building the future of energy.

About

Cuberg is commercializing next-generation battery technology to power the future of electric mobility. The company was acquired in 2021 by Northvolt, a global supplier of sustainable, high-quality battery cells and systems. As Northvolt's Advanced Technology Center operating in Silicon Valley, Cuberg is developing and commercializing lithium metal batteries, building an innovation ecosystem around lithium-ion technology, and leveraging Northvolt's state-of-the-art manufacturing capabilities to rapidly scale up production of advanced batteries.

Responsibilities

  • Analyze experimental results to understand the impact of cell materials on cell performance
  • Assist scientists and engineers with material preparation, cell assembly, and testing
  • Prepare reports, present and share results with team members
  • Work closely with the battery modeling team members

Requirements

  • Currently pursuing a B.S., M.S. or Ph.D. degree in Computer Science, Mechanical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Material Science, Electrical Engineering, Applied Math, Applied Physics, Chemistry, or related area
  • Fundamental knowledge of Li-ion cell electrochemistry and mechanisms
  • Strong background in mathematical modeling and data analysis
  • Excellent communication skills and team-oriented attitude
  • Comfortable with initiating and taking ownership of the projects
  • Advantageous Experience with Python and/or MATLAB
  • Experience in building and maintaining databases

Benefits

Paid time off, holidays

Algomo is a multilingual chatbot engine that provides instant resolutions to customer and employee queries in any language 🌎 .

We have developed a unique technology that is fluent in 109 languages. All the other commercial players (including Google, Microsoft, Amazon, IBM etc) combined support just 33. Algomo supports an additional 76 languages, bringing AI to the 1.3 Billion people who are currently left behing and are mainly living in emerging economies.

Our mission is to facilitate access to digital goods to anyone in the world, no matter what language they speak.

Algomo was founded in February 2020, by a technical CEO (ex VP of Data Science at Barclays), and is backed by research grantsf from UK and EU, is already generating revenue.

We also have pilots with P&G, Airports, Banks and the public sector.

Here is a 2-minute video demonstrating how the technology works.

The role

As a data science intern, you will have the opportunity to work alongside the technical CEO, who built the core technology, as well the rest of the technical and commercial team which is distributed across the globe.

We are using cutting edge NLP techniques (including zero-shot learning, multi-task learning, and transfer learning) to solve a real word problem of global importance.

Responsibilities

Improve/develop our core ML models, algorithms, and data sets running in production that are fuelling Algomo's contextual and language agnostic search.
Design, develop, test, deploy, support and evolve software and ML models.
Work on data pipelines, ETL and general data processing tasks.
Participate in an agile delivery process
Apply data scraping and data search algorithms
Document, collaborate and share your learnings with the rest of the team.
But more importantly, learn and grow as an individual!

Qualifications / Skills

On your way towards a degree (BSc, MSc or Ph.D.) in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics or similar scientific field
Experience using Python both for Data Science as well as software engineering.
Project experience in machine learning and especially in NLP
Attention to component reusability, data sharing and security.
Able to explain complex concepts in simple terms and be able to collaborate with a globally distributed team
Entrepreneurial, and a problem-solver who thrives in an autonomous environment.
Comfortable with being dropped into challenging technical problems and enjoy a fast-paced environment with constant growth and change
Having worked in AWS and experience with Docker and CI is a great plus.
Perks

This is a rare opportunity to be part of a truly innovative and global product from the ground up, and join early a startup that will soon be a growing business of exceptional engineers working on the latest technologies.
You will gain practical experience in the research and development of novel Machine Learning applications
You will work closely with a team of technologists and business developers in a very flat structure obtaining a great understanding of how an early-stage startup really works.
You will have the opportunity to join the company full-time post-internship after we have gone through our seed funding round.
You will experience coming to work in a vibrant environment at Natwest Accelerator in London (once lockdown is over)

Algomo is a diverse team and we promote equal opportunities in hiring.

This is an unpaid internship until funding is secured.

Kepler is on a Mission to bring the internet to space. Incorporated in 2015, Kepler’s guiding star is to enable the space economy through the creation of a communication network in Low Earth Orbit (LEO) that will provide connectivity services to other space missions, be they on orbit in LEO, MEO, GEO, or beyond. With an expanding base of early customers and our first 15 satellites in orbit, Kepler is continuing to grow and expand its most important asset – the Team! Based out of our HQ in Toronto and with an office in the UK and a newly formed office in the US we are building towards a truly global company delivering a product for the whole world.

We’re on the hunt for a top-tier Hardware Engineering Intern. Your focus will be on assisting the development and test of hardware, specifically hardware related to both our space-based communications payloads as well as ground-based assets. We are looking for exceptional candidates with the below experience along with any unique abilities that could be used to augment our hardware team. Here is a little more detail on what you can expect to work on:

Responsibilities:

  • Design schematics and PCB layout
  • Own new designs from start to finish or iterate on existing designs based on new feature requests and lessons learnt including switch mode power supplies, high speed design, and analog design
  • Assist with part selection and new project scoping and architecture
  • Participate in design reviews for all active designs
  • Perform functional and performance testing on individual boards or integrated sub-systems as part of prototype bring up, including development of test boards
  • Participate in pathfinding activities, new process planning, and design specification development

Requirements:

  • 3+ years in an electrical engineering degree program (currently enrolled)
  • Significant involvement in a hardware design (schematic and PCB layout) outside of class projects
  • Experience with one or more CAD tools (Altium, Eagle, Allegro, KiCad, Upverter, etc.)
  • Comfortable in a lab environment and experience using standard tools such as oscilloscopes, spectrum analyzers, multimeters, VNA’s, etc.
  • Ability to troubleshoot hardware issues
  • Ability to work in a team and independently with little supervision

Bonus Points:

  • Experience in a University design team or building circuits for a personal project
  • Python scripting experience
  • Knowledge of CubeSats

Kepler Communications Inc. is committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We welcome applications from: women, Aboriginal persons, persons with disabilities, ethnic minorities, visible minorities, people who identify as LGBT and others who may contribute to diversification in our workplace.

As part of our commitment to accessibility for all persons with disabilities, Kepler will, upon the request of the applicant, provide accommodation during the recruitment process to ensure equal access to applicants with disabilities. Please contact our People & Culture team, through our Career Page to make your accommodation needs known and we will consult with you to ensure suitable accommodation is provided.

Kepler is on a Mission to bring the internet to space. Incorporated in 2015, Kepler’s guiding star is to enable the space economy through the creation of a communication network in Low Earth Orbit (LEO) that will provide connectivity services to other space missions, be they on orbit in LEO, MEO, GEO, or beyond. With an expanding base of early customers and our first 15 satellites in orbit, Kepler is continuing to grow and expand its most important asset – the Team! Based out of our HQ in Toronto and with an office in the UK and a newly formed office in the US we are building towards a truly global company delivering a product for the whole world.

We're on the hunt for a top-tier RF/Antenna Intern.

Your focus will be on assisting RF hardware development and test, specifically hardware related to both our space-based communications payloads as well as ground-based assets. We are looking for exceptional candidates with the below experience along with any unique abilities that could be used to augment our small but strong RF team.

Responsibilites:

  • Assist more senior engineers in all activities related to RF/Antenna design, manufacture and test for spacecraft, ground terminals and test infrastructure
  • Assist in the design of new RF hardware by performing component selection, schematic capture, layout and fabrication as well as design reviews
  • Perform performance and acceptance testing for RF frontends and antennas using equipment such as VNAs, Spectrum Analyzers, Signal Generators and antenna range systems (far-field and near-field)
  • Write software to control test equipment or hardware under test in languages such as Python/C/VEE
  • Build infrastructure to assist in the testing of RF hardware
  • Simulate and model RF systems and structures for new designs and test setups

Requirements:

  • Currently enrolled in an Engineering, Physics or similar degree program
  • Experience in hardware design outside of class projects, particularly related to RF and/or Antennas. Experience on cubesat teams is a strong plus
  • Experience with circuit design/layout tools such as Altium/Eagle/KiCad
  • Experience with programming languages such as Python and C++, particularly as it relates to controlling hardware or modeling RF systems
  • Experience with a commercial RF designs tools such as ADS/CST/HFSS is a plus
  • Experience with basic RF concepts such as: impedance matching, smith chart, network analysis, active and passive microwave components and systems (mixers, amplifiers, transistors at RF frequencies) and their figures of merit (P1dB, Psat, IIP3, noise figure, etc.), RF filter design, antenna figures of merit
  • Some experience with RF test equipment such as VNAs, Spectrum Analyzers, Signal Generators and antenna test systems (far-field/near-field)

Kepler Communications Inc. is committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We welcome applications from: women, Aboriginal persons, persons with disabilities, ethnic minorities, visible minorities, people who identify as LGBT and others who may contribute to diversification in our workplace.

As part of our commitment to accessibility for all persons with disabilities, Kepler will, upon the request of the applicant, provide accommodation during the recruitment process to ensure equal access to applicants with disabilities. Please contact our People & Culture team, through our Career Page to make your accommodation needs known and we will consult with you to ensure suitable accommodation is provided.

What is Pathrise?
Pathrise (YC W18) is an online program for tech professionals that provides 1-on-1 mentorship, training and advice to help anyone land their next job. On top of that, we're built around aligned incentives. Fellows only pay when they get hired and start working at a job first.

Every day we are expanding our team and our services. We are looking for individuals who are ready to jump into a new role with us. We are a flourishing team and we really enjoy working together to improve our fellows chances of getting the jobs of their dreams! If this sounds like something you'd be interested we’d like the opportunity to get to know you more.

Our Mission
We seek to uplift job seekers in their careers and help them fulfill their hopes, ambitions, and livelihoods. Read more about why we’re driven to do this in our manifesto.

The Role
We’re looking for natural teachers who care about mentorship and uplifting others. As a Data Science Intern, your main responsibility would be to perform admission sessions for our Data track, helping fellows with technical interview prep and from time to time working on internal data projects.

Responsibilities

  • Handling 1-on-1 admissions sessions, technical interview prep and occasional behavioral prep
  • Investing in students’ personal stories and advising them on their career trajectory in the admissions calls and giving proactive feedback
  • Building up and improving on the admissions process for data fellows
  • Conduct data analysis for Pathrise and contribute to the overall effectiveness of the data track

Qualifications

  • 1+ years of experience working on data-related projects whether that be in academic projects, internships or other related work experience
  • A passion for mentorship!
  • Be available for 10+ hours a week
  • 1+ years of experience in data science, technology industry or in a related field
  • Experience with teaching, career advising, and mentorship in education or tech

Pathrise Values...

  • Growing employees: we value giving and receiving feedback (constructively) and we value continuous improvement. We want you to grow professionally and we include a professional development stipend to help you achieve that.
  • Diversity, equity and inclusion: we value people, opinions and thoughts from diverse backgrounds. Our culture is built upon the pillar of ‘DEI is not a separate initiative from Pathrise it is a part of Pathrise.’ We invite all to share their stories and we believe that it is through acceptance and curiosity that we can create a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace.

We cannot sponsor visas for this role at the time. Thank you for your interest.

Pathrise is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that proudly pursues and hires a diverse workforce. Pathrise does not make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of race, color, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender-identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable local, state, or federal laws or prohibited by Company policy. Pathrise also strives for a healthy and safe workplace and strictly prohibits harassment of any kind. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and other similar state laws and local ordinances, and its internal policy, Pathrise will also consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

If you are also interested in the fellowship, please apply here: https://www.pathrise.com/apply.

The Celo mission is to build a financial system that creates the conditions for prosperity for everyone.

Celo aims to remove the barriers for large-scale adoption of cryptocurrencies as means-of-payment. Using a novel address-based encryption algorithm, the Celo protocol makes sending money as easy as sending a text. Additionally, Celo uses stable-value tokens pegged to fiat currencies, like the US Dollar, to minimize volatility. Celo is an open protocol enabling many to participate in the system, even with a budget Android smartphone. The first application launching on the Celo platform is a social payments and money transfer app, aimed at developing markets.

We are looking to hire interns for a fully remote, 12 week software development opportunity to assist on our Protocol and Applications Engineering teams.

About Us:

  • We are a full-stack company i.e. we are building both blockchain protocols and the user experiences on top of them
  • We are experienced startup founders and operators
  • We are highly technical, with backgrounds at places like Google and MIT
  • We are mission driven with a big goal: to bring sound currency and property rights to those who need it most
  • We have a strong engineering culture, which values open-source

You will:

  • Implement, test, and audit the stability and/or identity portion of the Celo protocol
  • Build back-end services that power our APIs
  • Help to hit product milestones by writing high quality, well tested code
  • Perform and participate in code reviews
  • Work in a high performance scrum team
  • Collaborate with product and design teams

You have:

  • A strong passion for Celo's mission
  • Ability to write high quality, well tested code
  • Strong experience developing production software
  • Strong communication skills and ability to lead technical discussions
  • Experience building software that is reusable, extensible, and modular
  • A passion for testing and achieving high test coverage

  • Enthusiasm to work in a startup environment

cLabs ("Celo Labs") started Celo in 2018 and is one of many contributors to the open source project Celo. cLabs builds financial technology to enable prosperity of all beings.

cLabs is a Teal organization, a method of decentralized management and organizational governance. Roles are defined around the work, not people, and there is a high degree of autonomy. As such, we're all proud to hold the job title of "Partner." For more information on our culture, we encourage you to check out our blog at https://medium.com/celohq/the-future-is-teal-cc264a5d51d3.

To build technology and products that are used and loved by people and solve real-world problems, we need to build a team with many different perspectives and experiences. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply and always consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records, in accordance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

Applicants in need of special assistance or accommodation during the interview process or in accessing our website may contact us by sending an email to assistance(at)celo.org. We will treat your request as confidentially as possible. In your email, please include your name and preferred method of contact, and we will respond as soon as possible.

Doris Dev is helping to bring new consumer products to market, from concept to design, engineering, manufacturing, shipping & ongoing operations. Based in New York City & Hong Kong, Doris Dev is working on bringing hardware concepts to market and support operational needs through launch & beyond.

The Design Engineering intern will be able to design, test and build new products for innovative D2C brands

  • Completed or in process of completing a degree in mechanical engineering or industrial design
  • Experience working in small teams of engineers/designers/project managers
  • Interested in consumer product design & manufacturing

position: Full Stack Software Developer Intern - Editor Team
description:
At BioRender, our mission is to empower the world to learn and communicate science faster through visuals. We are passionate about democratizing science communication in order to accelerate scientific discovery and understanding. We're looking for amazing people to help create the world’s go-to-place and platform where science is communicated. Come join us!

We’re looking for a Full Stack Software Developer Intern to join our Editor Team in September 2021! Our stack includes React.js, Node.js, and MongoDB, with a lot of frontend technical challenges. Bonus points if you’re a fan of drafting/visualization tools or have previous experience working on a similar product!

Our ideal fit

  • Working towards a degree in computer science, computer engineering, or similar
  • Some educational background in mathematics and linear algebra
  • Excellent technical communication skills
  • Ability to explain complex solutions clearly to others
  • Growth mindset, excited to learn new libraries / technologies
  • Extremely curious, creative problem solver

What you'll be doing

  • Identify and build features that are highest impact to our users. Some projects on the roadmap are improving slides functionality, creating drawing tools (shapes, widgets, ‘bio-brushes’), and improving text functionality.
  • Responsible for the full feature design and implementation: code design, architecture (in collaboration with other team members), implementation, testing, QA, and deployment. You will take on similar projects to a junior full-timer. You’ll be paired with a full-time developer for onboarding, mentorship, and project coordination.
  • Proactively address product issues
  • Conduct peer code reviews, participate in team meetings and contribute to team efforts around code quality improvements

What you bring to the table

  • You have professional experience in our stack (MERN) or extensive web development background and challenging side projects
  • Experience with web-based graphics libraries, mathematics / linear algebra, game development, or animation is a plus (but not necessary for most projects)
  • Must be eligible to work in Canada

About us
BioRender is a software tool that allows scientists to accelerate groundbreaking research across the life sciences by reducing the time it takes to visually communicate research from many hours to just minutes while drastically improving outputs. We aim to save scientists over 1 billion hours of wasted time per year so they can spend it performing life-changing medical research, teaching the scientists of tomorrow, and helping people understand the world around them.

An incredible group of investors back us, including Y Combinator, Refactor and some of the most successful life science entrepreneurs in the world. Our customers range from the world’s largest pharmaceutical and biotech companies to the most renowned universities and research institutions.

Our tight-knit group is bonded by its shared commitment to our core values of resourcefulness, curiosity, integrity, empathy and humility. By both individually and collectively embodying these values, we can create clean, powerful, elegant solutions that delight our customers.

We are committed to building a warm, inclusive, and diverse environment. We believe that people do their best work when they feel good, and every member of our team deserves to feel safe, empowered, and supported. To this end, we offer a comprehensive set of benefits, including:

Competitive salary
Stock options in a hypergrowth startup - we're growing more than 100% year over year!
Health and dental benefits for you and your family from your first day, including an HSA and extended mental health benefits
Annual professional development budget and regular learning opportunities
3 Recharge Long Weekends per year, in addition to vacation days
Veterinary bill reimbursement program
Regular virtual team events to stay connected
Fast-paced, mission and values-driven environment with highly engaged coworkers

Ideally, you would work onsite at our office in Toronto; however, given the ongoing restrictions brought on by COVID-19, this is currently a remote position. We are open to considering continuing in a remote capacity once restrictions are lifted.

If your interest is piqued, please apply. We'd love to hear from you. Also, be sure to check out other listings on our Careers page.

BioRender is an equal opportunity employer and as such does not discriminate on the basis of race, colour, religion, sex, national origins, age, sexual orientation, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. Selection decisions are solely based on job-related factors.

We are seeking a CS student to join us for an internship in Fall 2021!

Opportunity highlights

  • Our CEO and CTO both have a track record of success. Our team brings together experience from Slack, Dropbox, Facebook, Amazon, Asana, Sequoia Capital, and many other well-known names in Silicon Valley.
  • We’re backed by incredible investors, with over $4M raised in our seed, led by Andreessen Horowitz.
  • The current tech team consists of the CTO and one ex-Amazon engineer.
  • Most importantly, we have a clear sense of what we need to build, and we cannot wait to execute on the plan with amazing people (like yourself!).

More about this role

  • This is an in-person paid internship based in downtown Seattle. In addition, we will cover your round-trip flight to Seattle and your housing (up to a certain amount).
  • Similar to a summer internship, you should be either taking the semester off, or taking a light course load to complete your last semester. This is not a part-time internship position.
  • Our codebase is in Typescript, React, and Node.js. Familiarity with these technologies is a plus but not a necessity.

position: MBA Summer Intern - Technical Product Management
description:
This is a remote position

Our Company:

Today, 1 in 3 Americans say they suffer from mental health problems like anxiety, depression, or insomnia. Despite this mental health epidemic, seeing a psychiatrist can take up to 3 months and cost as much as $500.

Shocked? Us too. That’s why we started Cerebral, a telemedicine-first mental health startup. We are breaking down the barriers to access mental healthcare so that anybody can get the care they need immediately. We provide tens of thousands of individuals across the nation with medication management, therapy, and counseling services. We launched publicly in January 2020 and are growing at over 40% month-over-month, and need your help.

How you will contribute:

  • Manage specific project(s) or initiative(s) end-to-end during your summer internship
  • Identify and implement initiatives that move company metrics; partnering with cross-functional teams to improve systems that drive company-wide change
  • Build beautiful products that change the lives of patients and providers by improving the access and outcome of mental healthcare
  • Utilize a combination of metrics, interviews, stakeholder strategy, and market data to inform the product roadmap
  • Own the end to end strategy and feature development while partnering with engineering for telehealth visit and communications user experiences for both patients and providers to deliver a continuously
  • Demonstrate a mix of intelligence, integrity, domain knowledge, verbal agility, and diplomacy which allows you to rapidly earn the trust of the organization
  • Own the delivery of OKRs, define KPIs and their drivers, while meeting SLAs
  • Inspire, champion, and coach as the need arises

Skills you’ll bring:

  • 3+ years' experience at a top-tier management consulting firm, investment banking, and/or experience in a Product, Business Operations, Internal Strategy or cross-functional operational role at a technology company
  • Accepted into an M.B.A. program
  • Eagerness to work independently with a strong sense of ownership
  • Ability to navigate ambiguity, prioritize and juggle multiple priorities with cross-functional stakeholders while hitting deadlines on time sensitive projects
  • Exceptional interpersonal skills and ability to develop strong working relationships
  • Resourcefulness, persistence, and ability to thrive in fast paced, entrepreneurial environment
  • You have sharp attention to detail with a natural feel for numbers and data, and have a high degree of accuracy in a fast-paced, results-oriented environment
  • You are proactive and have a positive attitude with a can-do, service-oriented mentality

About You:

  • Passionate about improving the access and outcomes of mental healthcare.
  • Strategic thinker with a pulse on the market.
  • Visionary
  • Utilize data to inform both tactical and strategic decisions
  • Adept at prioritizing value and shipping complex products requiring coordination across multiple teams
  • Love working with some of the best world-class engineers, product managers, and architects.
  • Strive to excel, innovate and take pride in your work
  • Work well with other leaders

Bonus points:

  • You are familiar with our tools & systems - Asana, Looker, Iterable, Google Optimize, Chargebee, Google docs, MS Office
  • You have experience with AB testing and leveraging data/analytics to evaluate outcomes
  • You have experience with telemedicine or mental health care start ups

Must be based in the United States, and legally authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis. We are not able to sponsor work visas at this time.

TapTab is a cutting-edge mobile application that is inventing the future of the dining experience, and we’re looking for great people who are excited about that future.

We are currently seeking a Backend Engineering Interns to join our development team. Our summer internship program runs from June 28 - September 3, 2021. As a Backend Engineering Intern, you will work on backend development tasks. Specific assignments will vary depending upon your interests and skills.

This is an excellent opportunity to participate in an exciting, emerging startup at an early stage; learn from a fun, friendly and highly-motivated team of developers; gain valuable work experience; and enhance your resume for future opportunities.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Your responsibilities will be to:

• Work with TapTab backend engineers on innovative web applications
• Research, test and contribute to the adoption of software architecture, programming languages and new technologies
• Write, test and document code, and ensure code quality, reliability and optimal performance

QUALIFICATIONS

• Recent Sofware Engineering Bootcamp graduate OR full-time undergraduate or graduate student in Computer Science or related field at an accredited college or university
• 3.0 GPA or higher
• Proficiency in and experience with backend end programming languages, specifically Node.js and Postgres SQL databases
• Interest in developing scalable, adaptive, high-performance apps
• Ability to write and test high-quality, readable, reliable and well-architected code
• Ability to define, understand, develop, test and iterate new product features
• Experience with markup languages
• Familiarity with Git version control
• Strong written and verbal communication skills

BONUS SKILLS & QUALITIES

• Deep interest in software development and knowledge of latest technological developments
• Knowledge of frontend or mobile development using React.js, Swift or Kotlin
• Interest in startups

The Backend Engineering Intern position is an unpaid role, and the intern is not considered an employee for wage purposes and shall not receive employee benefits, such as health or dental insurance, or pension or retirement credit. Participation in the internship does not guarantee the intern a job at the conclusion of the internship.

Applicants who receive college/university credit for internships are strongly encouraged to apply. And TapTab is happy to work with your educational institution to help you earn credit for your internship.

As a Frontend Engineer for Beacon, you'll leverage Swift to help build Beacon's iOS App as we launch in the coming months. You'll work closely with our technical founder in developing a platform that college students and young adults will use to search for interesting local events and plan things to do with friends. Our goal is to bring people together while benefiting local small businesses that have been struggling. The role requires experience with Swift, AutoLayout (not storyboards), and asynchronous functions.

Timeline: June 28th - August 13th
Paid Stipend: $800 for 8 weeks
Website: https://beaconapp.info
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/beaconnyc_/

We are looking for passionate Mobile Developer to lead development of our mobile apps. You will work closely with a set of talented engineers, product managers, designers and data scientists to bring innovative ideas to life.

What You’ll Be Doing

  • Work as part of a small team to build IOS / Android applications.
  • Architect, build and maintain excellent quality applications with clean code.
  • Implement pixel perfect UI's that match designs.
  • Implement clean, modern, smooth animations and transitions that provide an excellent user experience.
  • Integrate with third-party API's.
  • Write unit and integration tests.
  • Release applications to IOS and Google Play stores.
  • Work with native modules when required.
  • Be part of a community of developers that share knowledge and help each other as problems arise.

Requirements

  • 0+ years of professional experience working with mobile applications.
  • Experience with the following technologies a plus, but not required(React.js, Swift, Angular).
  • Meaningful experience working on large, complex systems.
  • Ability to take extreme ownership over your work. Every day is a challenge to ensure you are performing to the expectations you and your team have agreed upon, both in regards to estimates and to general process.
  • An understanding of native apps best practices and a commitment to following them.
  • Ability to work through new and difficult issues and contribute to libraries as needed.
  • Ability to create and maintain continuous integration and delivery of applications.
  • A positive mindset and can-do attitude.
  • English Skills (ability to effectively communicate via written and spoken english)

Selected intern's day-to-day responsibilities include:

1.Designing and building the website front-end.
2.Creating the website architecture.
3.Designing and managing the website back-end including database and server integration.
4.Generating WordPress themes and plugins.
5.Conducting website performance tests.
6.Troubleshooting content issues.
7.Monitoring the performance of the live website.

Selected intern's day-to-day responsibilities include:

  1. Delegating tasks to team members
  2. Collaborating with the team to identify and fix technical problems
  3. Creating end goals for the team
  4. Guiding their team through technical issues and challenges
  5. Identifying bottlenecks and bugs and devising solutions to these problems
  6. Review team members code and deploying the code to production
  7. Participating in the company's routine and protocols

At Overjet, we are building applications that improve healthcare, dentistry in particular, by leaps and

bounds. We are solving the most challenging problems in dentistry to improve care for millions of

patients. Come join us as a senior software/full-stack/backend engineer and be an integral part of an

exceptional team.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop Java Spring Boot based enterprise applications for an SaaS product
  • Architect, implement, and optimize scalable databases
  • Enhance quality, usability, performance, security, and reliability of systems
  • Design, develop, test, maintain, monitor, debug, etc.
  • Collaborate with other teams to prioritize tasks and deliver results on time

Required skills:

  • 2+ years' experience building backend applications
  • Experience in at least one cloud stack - GCP, AWS, or Azure
  • Expertise in Java and Java Spring frameworks
  • Proficiency in both SQL as well as NoSQL databases, especially Postgres
  • Knowledge of REST APIs
  • Knowledge of Pub sub mechanisms
  • Knowledge of Docker and Kubernetes

Preferred skills:

  • Developer certificate from either AWS or GCP or Azure
  • Grasp of GraphQL frameworks, especially SPQR
  • Implementation experience on Near Real time systems
  • Familiarity with Google Cloud Platform, i.e. storage, compute, cloud sql, app engine and k8s
  • Work experience in healthcare domain a plus
  • Knowledge of automation testing frameworks, TDD, and integration testing

Full Job Description
The Role

We are looking for a new Manager to join our growing team. Our ideal candidate will have a passion for establishing strong relations and natural curiosity for website optimization, and a knack for being proactive in pursuing growth opportunities for their book of business. You will work with a group of amazing SEO team members that you are able to learn from and bounce ideas off of. Read on, if this sounds like your next challenge!

You Will Be

  • Working on multiple client websites by implementing changes to various aspects in order to comply with Google's best practices.
  • Expected to retain existing business, while pursing profitable growth opportunities in assigned clients accounts.
  • Communicating via phone/email with clients on a regular basis. Strategizing with team members to come up with creative solutions for our clients.
  • Keeping up with the SEO industry through blogs, publishers, competitive research, etc
  • Creating reports to gauge progress and inform the client of the value being provided
  • Presenting your findings to the client in order to influence their onsite content strategy
  • Leading the sales process while calling upon others to assist in solution development and proposal delivery
  • Working with a client’s development team to implement changes to their website or on your own with approval from the client.

You Must Have

  • well to do knowledge of website and how to make changes and use different methods to make the product good.
  • 0-4 years experience doing SEO work for clients within an agency environment
  • Proficient with keyword research/data mining tools and competitive analysis
  • Technical knowledge of website architecture (experience with HTML Markup, CSS, XML).
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Excel, Word, Outlook, and other common applications
  • Experience with content management systems such as Wordpress, Joomla, and Magento
  • High level of comfort using email and the Internet, specifically search engines such as Google, Bing, etc.
  • Ability to quickly pick up new skills and learn new tasks
  • Proven track record of successful project management and multi-tasking skills with the ability to hit and exceed deadlines required
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and oral while paying close attention to details

Send your resume at careers@tripetrip.com

💘 Our Mission

Shinkei Systems builds robotics that multiply the shelf-life of wild caught fish.

With only 1 in every 3 fish caught making it to a plate, the fishing industry has numerous waste problems to solve from both tails of the operational chain that could save billions.

Spun out from researchers at Carnegie Mellon School of Computer Science, Shinkei uses computer vision and robotics to redefine how we treat the animals we catch and eat. We are experienced moonshot prototypers and have exhibited design work internationally at top venues. Our board has professors from the top robotics schools in the world and experienced founders in the area.

We are looking for energetic folks to join our team who are excited to create technology that transforms the world at scale.

👀 The Opportunity

Ever wonder why we pay a premium for sushi?

Why confined, farmed fish are the standard in supermarkets?

How large legacy industries operationally tick?

Shinkei is looking for mechanical engineers for a paid opportunity over the summer to work on transforming society’s relationship with an animal that feeds billions of mouths annually. We’re on the lookout for people who love to get their hands dirty building working prototypes for moonshot ideas and who can take responsibility meeting deadlines over extended project timelines.

You won't be limited to clinking metal — we believe engineers should be involved in company strategy, product direction, and anything else you might be interested in.

What You Get To Do:

  • Design real robotics solutions to solve major humanitarian concerns
  • Utilize mechanical engineering tools by building a product end-to-end
  • Work autonomously in a fast-paced entrepreneurial environment from either New York or Philadelphia
  • Unrestricted access to a makerspace
  • Talk to real customers for user research on design
  • Set the foundation for our engineering culture
  • Travel to Maryland to try out traditional techniques aboard industrial boats
  • Have a hand in transforming our relationship with our food

What You Need:

  • An innovative mind with a practical bend and an interest in changing the way we consume our food
  • Pursuing bachelors or masters in Mechanical Engineering, Robotics, similar field or sufficient previous experience
  • Background (portfolio, side projects, coursework) in physical prototyping, gantry design and misc. mechanical engineering projects
  • Basic abilities with mechanical design tools (SolidWorks, FEA, drawings and documentation)
  • Capable of researching, designing and testing using rapid prototyping techniques
  • Experience with lab testing and fabrication equipment
  • Familiarity with common manufacturing processes a plus
  • Exposure and interest to robotics or embedded systems a strong plus

Greetings Adventurous Programmer

We, the artists, builders, dreamers and denizens of StartupLandia have evolved to the point that we think we'd like to create an internship program.

We are a small team of senior level engineers and a few designers.

We love the intersection of entrepreneurship, design and technical product engineering.

Many of us have been founders and generally speaking, we build exclusively for founders in the Seed to Series A range.

As an intern, you would have the opportunity to...

  1. Pair with senior engineers on 4 different projects ranging from rails, to node, react native, to flutter with maybe some elixir or swift mixed in there.
  2. Work directly on an in house ticketing app that StartupLandia CTO is hammering on, a rails/twilio/stripe/pay-musicians direct thingy.
  3. Write some cool blog posts about your experiences that hopefully document soon to be accelerated changes in your professional skills.
  4. Gain valuable expeience and possibly some references that will help you make the jump into a full time junior position somewhere.

As an intern, you would...

  • Probably be self taught or someone who completed a coding bootcamp
  • Interested in learning from the fire hose and very self directed
  • Capable of signing an NDA and working like a professional
  • Have a good understanding of the HTTP roundtrip web software process
  • Have some exposure to rails & react
  • Have great communication skills
  • A desire to help Startuplandia's mission while helping yourself

We think that this is a six week kind of program where the payment mechanism is based on us paying you for a weekly blog post, something like $200/post/week would work out to $1200 for 6 weeks (1099 contract). You can pair with senior devs and work on an internal project we have as much or as little makes sense for your growth. After 6 weeks has past, if things go well, you would then have a professional grade commit history and a recommendation from me to assist your journey into the great unknown.

If this sounds interesting to you, please respond to this post with 3-5 bullet points about yourself that support the above scenarios.

Cheers,

John D
Founder, CTO
startuplandia.io

P.S. - DO NOT EMAIL ME OR ATTEMPT TO GET ON MY RADAR DIRECTLY, I'M SUPER BUSY & CONSTANTLY FIGHTING FOR MY FOCUS :)

position: Financial Engineering and Data Science Intern

location.city: Los Angeles • Santa Monica • Los Angeles County

description:
Our new startup, Pace It, is focused on helping retirees convert their hard-earned assets into lifelong paychecks. Millions of baby-boomers are retiring and are facing a tough problem of enjoying their retirement without running out of money. Our digital platform tailors a personalized drawdown strategy for them and assists them to stick by it. By addressing the unique financial circumstances of retirees, PaceIt is poised to become the one-stop solution for all the boomers’ financial needs.

We are four founders with many years of combined experience in the retirement space. We have been helping individuals accumulate for retirement and have realized that there is no good solution to guide them through withdrawals once those individuals retire. We are leveraging our experience and wide network with retirement plan providers and record keepers to distribute our solution. We have already signed a major 401(k) record keeper as our launch partner. We are now focused on building our core team towards a launch of our MVP in 2021. The company is well funded to achieve that goal.

We’re currently looking for a phenomenal financial engineer with data science capabilities for an unpaid internship starting on June 21, 2021. The internship will allow you to grow and to take part in a multi-disciplinary development effort. Two of the founders are UCLA professors with many years of experience coaching graduate students.

Example of the tasks that you might be asked to complete:
• Develop Monte Carlo simulations for modeling retirement portfolios.
• Use machine learning algorithms to improve portfolio modeling.
• Analyze transaction data and develop algorithms for tracking individuals spending versus their budgets.
• Develop machine learning algorithm to predict life expectancy and spending patterns of retirees.

Requirements:
• Previous work in a start-up and/or hi-tech environment is a plus.
• Experience modeling investment risk and return using Monte Carlo simulations.
• Experience using statistical computer languages (mostly Python) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets.
• Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, tree-based techniques, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks. Familiarity with Tensor flow and Keras is a plus.
• Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications.
• A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques.
• Previous experience with cloud technology (AWS in particular) is an advantage.

This is a rare opportunity to take part in a high-growth venture at an early stage and help build a company with an important mission. If you want to do good and do well, help us create a needed financial solution for the many baby boomers retiring every day.

Want to make an impact this year? At Assured, you'll work with a 7 person team of extraordinarily passionate engineers working to reimagine the insurance industry.

🧱 Get in on a startup on truly the ground floor. Together, we'll shape the future of the company.

Who we are...

Assured aims to disrupt the insurance industry by modernizing its most archaic component: claims. Currently, 300,000 claims adjusters spend their days talking on the phone and typing into unstructured text fields. We can do better—by combining logic, inference, and modern computer vision tools, we're able to both increase efficiency and improve customer satisfaction. By rearchitecting how the underlying information is ingested and stored, we're poised to impact the core of a trillion dollar industry.

We're two second time founders out of Stanford who care about transforming the world with software. We've built companies from enterprise software to aerospace, and couldn't be more excited about taking on the insurance industry.

There's so much to do. We can't wait for you to join us.

🔎 Collaborate with the CEO and CTO to identify and prioritize the most impactful improvements to our product
😍 Implement delightful, functional user experiences

You may be a fit if you...

💪 Have substantial, self-initiated projects that you're proud of
🚀 Want to dive into the world of startups

Bonus points...
✨ We're currently using Typescript, Node.js, React, and GraphQL, however that will evolve. The most important thing is that you're nimble, intelligent, and hard working.

Kintsugi is developing smarter mental healthcare with voice biomarkers. Our team has been awarded multiple National Science Foundation SBIR awards for developing new AI technologies. In our latest technical milestone, we’re now able to detect depression and anxiety from less than 20 seconds of free form speech.

The current opening is for an intern role. We're a hybrid, remote first team. You'd be expected to come into the office one to two days a week, depending on meetings & other team collaboratory efforts. Through the summer you'd be working with all our engineers, participating in sprints meeting, standup and sprint.

When you think about your last doctor’s appointment, how much do you actually recall? If you’re like most people, you’ll likely forget over 40% of the conversation. Details fall through the cracks, generic printouts you receive end up in the trash, and important information never makes it to other doctors. Ultimately, you’re left needing to connect the dots in your care. That’s why we started Abridge with a simple thesis: if we can shift agency to consumers, we can help them stay on top of their health. When you use Abridge to record your health conversations, the conversations themselves become your medical record. It’s as easy as that.

We are looking for research interns to working on exciting NLP challenges using our large annotated proprietary healthcare datasets. You will be able to create/customize your internship research statement and collaborate with our in-house Machine Learning research team. At the end of the internship, you will also have the opportunity to publish your work at top tier conferences such as NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, NAACL, and ACL.

The goal of the internship is to advance the state-of-the-art in one or many of the following research areas:

  • Dialog Understanding
  • Sequence-to-Sequence Modeling
  • Clinical Natural Language Processing
  • Information Extraction
  • Machine Learning using Ontologies or Knowledge graphs

Required Qualification:

  • Must be accepted to or currently enrolled in an MS or Ph.D. program in Computer Science or a related field
  • Must have at least one NLP machine learning paper submitted or published
  • Experience in utilizing theoretical and empirical research to solve problems
  • Ability to communicate complex research ideas in a clear, precise, and actionable manner

*Research internships are offered year-round with flexible durations

Compensation

  • $80,000-$100,000 per year

Life at Abridge

At Abridge, we’re driven by our mission to bring understanding and follow-through to every medical conversation. Our culture is founded on doing things the “inverse” way in a legacy system—focusing on patients, instead of the system; focusing on outcomes, instead of billing; and focusing on the end-user experience, instead of a hospital administrator's mandate.

Abridgers are engineers, scientists, designers, and health policy experts from a diverse set of backgrounds—an experiment in alchemy that helps us transform an industry dominated by EHRs and enterprise into a consumer-driven experience, one recording at a time. We believe in strong ideas, loosely held, and place a high premium on a growth mindset. We push each other to grow and expose each other to the latest in our respective fields. Whether it’s holding a PhD-level deep dive into understanding fairness and underlying bias in machine learning models, debating the merits of a Scandinavian design philosophy in our UI/UX, or writing responses for Medicare rules to influence U.S. health policy, we prioritize sharing our findings across the team and believe that "you need to taste good things to have good taste."

Abridge is an equal opportunity employer. Diversity and inclusion is at the core of what we do. We actively welcome applicants from all backgrounds (including but not limited to race, gender, educational background, and sexual orientation).
Work with our technical founding team to bring a prototype to production. Learn about state-of-the-art computer vision and sensor fusion topics as well as machine learning and deep learning.

Graduaute in Technology.

Join a leading fintech company that’s democratizing real estate investing for all.

Fintor was founded with a simple idea: real estate investing markets should be accessible to all, not just the wealthy. Fintor is a mobile app to buy and sell fractional shares in real estate properties with as little as $5 per share within a few taps. We enable everyone to have access, liquidity, and clarity to the real estate markets that have traditionally been available to a selected few. Just as we focus on our customers, we also strive to create an inclusive environment where our employees can thrive and do impactful work.

You will be joining as one of the first interns at a fast growing startup backed by some of the most recognizable investors including 500 Startups, Graphene Ventures, Hustle Fund, celebrities like Manny Khoshbin, and more. We share the same investor as Robinhood, Lyft, Facebook, Snapchat, Udemy, Canva, Venmo and many more unicorns.

You will be working directly with the co-founders of Fintor. Learn more at https://fintor.com

*Please check out our website to get a better understanding of what we are building.

About the role
Our react native app intern helps us deliver on our mission by creating high quality code and outstanding user experiences. As an intern, you’ll work directly with our team on projects and products from ideation to rollout, and beyond. Security and simplicity is core to Fintor’s mission on the engineering team and critical to how we build our products from inception and design to deployment in the cloud. This role will work closely with our CTO to build beautiful user experiences, highly performant, scalable systems, and develop state of the art support software to power Fintor’s trading engine. Internships are about learning and at Fintor you will learn about startups and what goes on behind the scenes in working with serial entrepreneur founders.

In this role you will be

  • Build customer facing features in our React Native applications for iOS and Android, working with native modules when required.
  • Write and maintain clean, tested, and well-documented code.
  • Work with the mobile app serverless backend on a modern cloud infrastructure and integrate with internal and third-party APIs.
  • Collaborate with UX design and implement designs with clean, modern transitions that provide an excellent user experience.
  • Identify and correct bottlenecks and fix bugs, ensuring the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of the application at scale.
  • Work with CI/CD pipelines for testing and deployments.

We are looking for

  • Someone that believes in our mission with a positive mindset and understanding of the early-stage startup environment.
  • Development experience for high-quality production React Native projects.
  • Experience with serverless architecture on a AWS cloud infrastructure, including integrating with API.
  • Proficient in TypeScript, JavaScript (ES 6), NodeJs, React Native, Expo and experience in related tools like Redux, REST, GraphQL, and Git.
  • Familiarity with native build tools, like XCode, and testing platforms.
  • A strong passion for creating innovative user features and interactions.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Benefits

  • An opportunity to join a fast-growing fintech startup that is changing the world of finance and real estate investing.
  • Learn about every aspect of building a company by working directly with founders.
  • A seat at the table to share your ideas and make your voice heard.
  • Be part of a company with a real mission you can be proud of.

Fintor is committed to fostering a fair, inclusive, and equal work environment. We strive to create a workplace that reflects the communities that we serve, where each team member is empowered to come to work as their true self. Diverse teams are more successful, which is why Fintor aims to be a leader in workplace equality and move both our company and the industry forward.

The selected individuals will work in several projects developing software for different robotic platforms, mainly for integration tasks, testing, validation and reporting.

Requirements
• Candidate for a degree in Computer Science, Robotics or Equivalent
• Experience developing in C++. Experience in Python or ROS are a plus.
• A proactive team working attitude
• Excellent Spoken and Written English
• Strong writing skills in technical documentation

Responsibilities
• Development of robotics software involving perception, navigation, HRI and control
• Code QA through Unit Tests

The intern will work directly with our CTO and will receive significant training.

This is a 2-month month summer internship for 35 hours per week, paying $14.25 per hour.

You must be aged between 15 and 30 and be legally entitled to work in Canada. International students are not eligible

Tasks and Responsibilities
This role is not limited to programming, but also works to build the student's leadership and communication skills. Under supervision, the student will be directly exposed to user experience research methods. After conducting interviews with underrepresented & disconnected communities to identify gaps, the student will work on technical solutions to those challenges under leadership and support of the technical lead.

Software Development: Apply design skills to real life settings with direct impact. Learn to design for a wide range of nationalities, computer literacies, and language skills, considering human factors and site visits on an ongoing basis.

Knowledge translation: Eagerness to learn and interest in business of technology, and working closely with tech lead to prioritize and translate the results of interviews with community organizers, and citizens into lean digital tools

Pilot Support: Develop analytical, critical learning, and leadership skills working closely with our clients to co-develop robust, impactful solutions, ensuring to fix issues, suggest improvements, and ensure critical fixes are deployed in a timely manner

Quality Assurance: Work with Tech Lead to build key metrics, and reports to make sure product development team is constantly improving and growing

Technical Development: Demonstrate curiosity to explore novel areas in computer science and apply learnings push personal technical limitations with diligent documentation

Experience with web development, knowledge of HTML, JS, and CSS required, experience with React would be an asset

Experience with UX/UI, relational databases querying and management, SQL or R an asset

Summary
This position is for a driven individual who enjoys data science, engineering and has an interest in reverse aging. The work will allow the intern to expand their data science, software engineering, bioinformatics, writing, communication, and organizational skills. The Data Science Intern will be responsible for leading the data science endeavors. The intern must be proactive and move forward on tasks with only a small amount of guidance. The position provides an opportunity to see new methods of reverse aging as they come into existence. If you are organized, familiar with version control, and have great communication skills this job may be for you.

Responsibilities

  1. Lead data science projects using a wide-variety of data sets.
  2. Produce data visualizations using aging-related data sets.
  3. Work with team members and consultants on a wide variety of tasks.
  4. Create and revise data science analyses applied to biological data sets.
  5. Develop data science and software engineering products and services.
  6. Work with the team to create data engineering systems related to aging research.
  7. Interact with various partners, teams, and engineers.

Requirements

  1. Superior written communication and organizational skills
  2. Strong ability to write Python code
  3. Ability to perform industry grade data science on biology data sets
  4. Ability to write SQL code
  5. Ability to use version control
  6. Ability to use Jupyter Notebook
  7. Ability to use Git Bash, terminals, etc.
  8. Proficient in MS Word and willingness to use Sublime Text 3
  9. Self-directed

Working Hours
Working hours are flexible.

ABOUT US
At ZaiNar, we’re leveraging patented innovations using software-defined radios and advanced signal processing to build revolutionary new products in Positioning, Navigation, and Timing. Our imaginative team has developed the world’s most precise network time synchronization and distribution capabilities – wirelessly syncing to sub-nanosecond accuracy. We’re solving leading edge problems in RF location tracking and network communications. Our initial target market is asset tracking in dynamic industrial environments ($10B+), and the opportunities beyond that are endless. ZaiNar already complies with release 16 of 3GPP standards for 5G, to enable ZaiNar location tracking for any 5G-NR device without hardware changes. ZaiNar is VC-backed by tier 1 funds including Softbank, and has graduated from multiple accelerator programs including StartX, Alchemist, and Plug and Play.

Ensuring a diverse and inclusive workplace, where the best idea wins, is important to us. So, come join a curious, collaborative, and forward-thinking team, where everyone has the freedom to shape their own future, our company‘s, and the world’s – one nanosecond at a time.

THE ROLE
Join a team of brilliant engineers developing the next generation of networked software-defined radio systems to support ZaiNar’s super-precise network time distribution capabilities. We are seeking an Engineering Intern for Summer 2021. ZaiNar is looking for highly motivated software interns to be a part of a star team. Our company is seeking self-starters who are interested in owning real engineering projects during their internship. ZaiNar Engineering is in an important phase of product development, and there are many interesting projects. A well-matched intern will bring excitement, curiosity, and flexibility to the role.

We are prepared for, and flexible with, working from home. Due to the pandemic, the role will be partially or fully remote, but we do have an office in downtown Redwood City, CA that is open with strict safety guidelines in place and in compliance with all the current local, state, and CDC regulations.

COMPELLING ATTRIBUTES
● Studying computer science, EE, or related fields towards a post-graduate degree (PhD preferred)
● Strong data analytics, signal processing and/or wireless communication background
● Familiarity with super-resolution algorithms for angle of arrival estimation
● Background in estimation theory and statistical signal processing
● Solid knowledge of convex and non-convex optimization techniques
● Experience with Python, C++, and comparable programming languages
● Experience with Linux development environment
● Experience with radio hardware (hobby or professional)
● Ability to be a self-starter and solve problems proactively
● Excited about working in an agile, startup work environment
● Ability to work independently and provide creative solutions
● Excited about deploying tech in multiple test environments and locations
● Fluency in English (written and spoken)

ALSO INTERESTING
● Web development and data visualization
● Embedded firmware experience
● Hardware build skills
● Knowledge of RF lab equipment

Starfish Space is a space startup in Kent Washington founded by former Blue Origin and NASA engineers. We are giving life to on-orbit services with our Otter Space Tug and satellite servicing technologies.

Position Description
Rendezvous, Proximity Operations, and Docking (RPOD) is an essential phase of any satellite servicing mission. Starfish Space is developing CEPHALOPOD, RPOD software that is capable of docking with efficient electric propulsion. This position will support the development of that technology, and relies heavily on astrodynamics and guidance navigation and control skills. The engineer will do everything ranging from developing GNC algorithms, to refining concepts of operation, to running simulation analysis.

Qualifications

  • Must be a US person (citizen or permanent resident)
  • Willing to work from Kent, Washington
  • Engineering or sciences education or experience
  • Capable of working a dynamic, fast paced startup environment
  • Software and/or computer programming capability

Desired Experience

  • B.S. degree or equivalent in Aerospace Engineering or similar field
  • Programming experience in Python and/or C
  • Working knowledge of Astrodynamics
  • Working knowledge of rendezvous, proximity operations, and docking techniques
  • Working knowledge of numerical techniques such as optimization and/or machine learning

Starfish Space is a space startup in Kent Washington founded by former Blue Origin and NASA engineers. We are giving life to on-orbit services with our Otter Space Tug and satellite servicing technologies.

Position Description
Satellite servicing missions require autonomous, robotic actions in orbit. To fulfill our mission Starfish is developing the Otter space tug and the Nautilus capture mechanism to interact with and maximize the operational value of satellites. This position will support the development of that technology, and relies heavily on mechanical engineering, electromechanical prototyping, and system design skills. The engineer will do everything ranging from designing in CAD, to manufacturing prototypes, to designing and executing a test plan.

Qualifications

  • Must be a US person (citizen or permanent resident)
  • Willing to work from Kent, Washington
  • Engineering or sciences education or experience
  • Capable of working a dynamic, fast paced startup environment
  • Mechanical and/or electrical prototyping capability

Desired Experience

  • B.S. degree or equivalent in Aerospace Engineering or similar field
  • Previous experience designing and/or prototyping space systems
  • Programming experience in Python and/or C
  • Working knowledge of mechanical engineering
  • Working knowledge of electrical engineering

Invitae is dedicated to bringing comprehensive genetic information into mainstream medicine to improve healthcare for billions of people. Our team is driven to make a difference for the patients we serve. We are leading the transformation of the genetics industry by making genetic testing affordable and accessible for everyone to guide health decisions across all stages of life.

POSITION SUMMARY

The Site Reliability Engineer internship position is responsible for a variety of process and infrastructure initiatives, including platform maintenance and enhancements for our flagship cloud-based genomics product, automating existing pipelines to improve efficiency and long-term ecosystem health, performing software updates across our AWS platform, and ensuring that managed assets are performing as expected through the use of telemetry, automated alerts, and self-healing infrastructure.

RESPONSIBILITIES

As an intern, your job duties may involve some or many of the below duties:

  • Ensure that the infrastructure supporting our genomics platform is highly available, scalable, and maintainable
  • Maintain and extend existing configuration management deployments
  • Perform software installations using existing infrastructure and configuration management tools
  • Collaborate with the Cloud Operations team to migrate existing deployment tools into a fully automated and managed process
  • Collaborate with DevOps team to extend and enhance existing CI/CD pipelines
  • Work directly with the DevOps team and software engineers to ensure system integrity
  • Monitor metrics and develop ways to improve telemetry gathering, reporting, and alerting
  • Follow all best practices and procedures as established by company
  • Review, understanding, and compliance with Invitae HIPAA Security policies and procedures
  • Safeguarding the privacy and security of protected health information and European Union personal data
  • Processing and handling of European Union personal data only as directed by Invitae for purposes of personalized molecular pathology

EXPERIENCE

As an intern, you should be familiar with many of the items below, though it is also expected that many of these skills would be developed while serving in this position:

  • Current student in computer science or related field, or equivalent working experience
  • 3 years in an SRE/DevOps role, or related IT or operations field
  • Familiar with Linux and Bash
  • Familiar with configuration management tools (e.g. Salt, Ansible, Chef, Puppet)
  • Familiar with AWS tools and infrastructure (EC2, S3, IAM, ECS, Lambda, and CloudWatch)
  • Familiar with CI/CD tools (e.g. Jenkins), and scripting languages (Python strongly preferred)
  • Familiar with IAC tools such as Terraform (preferred)
  • Familiar with containerized systems in a cloud environment
  • Familiar with Scrum and Agile development methodologies
  • Good interpersonal skills and communication with all levels of management

KEY ATTRIBUTES

  • Drive and determination
  • Ability to work in a fast paced and dynamic environment
  • Ability to participate with others as a member of the team to ensure that demanding and difficult projects are handled smoothly and cooperatively to enhance the success of the projects and maintain strong relationships within all parts of the company
  • Strong communication and presentation skills
  • Self-starter
  • Driven to perform
  • Able to organize, prioritize, and delegate tasks to efficiently move projects forward

EDUCATION

  • Current student in computer science or related field, or equivalent working experience

We will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

position: Data Science Intern, Decision Science (Fall 2021) - Canada
description:
Coursera was launched in 2012 by two Stanford Computer Science professors, Andrew Ng and Daphne Koller, with a mission to provide universal access to world-class learning. It is now one of the largest online learning platforms in the world, with 82 million registered learners as of March 31, 2021. Coursera partners with over 200 leading university and industry partners to offer a broad catalog of content and credentials, including Guided Projects, courses, Specializations, certificates, and bachelor’s and master’s degrees. More than 6,000 institutions have used Coursera to upskill and reskill their employees, citizens, and students, including in high-demand fields such as data science, technology, and business. Coursera became a B Corp in February 2021.

At Coursera, our Data Science team is helping to build the future of education through data-driven decision making and data-powered products. We drive product and business strategy through measurement, experimentation, and causal inference. We define, develop, and launch the models and algorithms that power content discovery, personalized learning, and machine-assisted teaching and grading. We believe the next generation of teaching and learning should be personalized, accessible, and efficient. With our scale, data, technology, and talent, Coursera and its Data Science team are positioned to make that vision a reality.

We are looking for a creative and collaborative Data Science intern to accelerate decision science at Coursera. During this full-time 16-week internship program, you will be embedded as a full-time member of our Data Science team and paired with a mentor. You will work on real features and build internal tools that inform our decision about how best to serve our 68+ million learners worldwide!

This internship will run from August 30 - December 17. It will be fully remote, but you will need to work remotely from one of the following Canadian provinces: Ontario, British Columbia, Alberta, Manitoba, New Brunswick, Newfoundland and Labrador, Nova Scotia, Prince Edward Island, or Saskatchewan. We will begin reviewing applications on May 24.

Responsibilities:

  • Design, build, and share internal reporting for Data Scientists and Product Managers to better understand how learners are interacting with our product
  • Collaborate with Product Managers, Designers, and other Data Scientists to identify opportunities to improve learner experiences on Coursera
  • Design and analyze experiments that will evaluate new features and inform product direction
  • Distill insights from complex data, communicating findings to technical and non-technical audiences

Basic Qualifications:

  • Pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, or related field and returning to the program after the internship
  • Experience with relational databases and SQL for data retrieval

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with at least one scripting language (e.g. Python)
  • Experience with at least one statistical software package (e.g. R, NumPy/SciPy/Pandas)
  • Experience with explaining technical concepts to non-technical audiences
  • Experience with designing clear and informative data visualizations
  • Project management and cross-functional collaboration skills

If this opportunity interests you, you might like these courses on Coursera:

  • Marketing Analytics
  • Data-Driven Decision Making

Coursera is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer and considers all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected class.

If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, please contact us at accommodations@coursera.org.

Please review our CCPA Applicant Notice here.
